Title: [L08] Re-implementing ECDSA signature recovery
Content:
The following functions include implementations of the ECDSA signature recovery function:


* [`castVoteBySig` in the `GovernorAlpha` contract](https://github.com/fei-protocol/fei-protocol-core/blob/29aeefddd97f31c7f2a598fb3dca3ef24dc0beb4/contracts/dao/GovernorAlpha.sol#L261)
* [`delegateBySig` in the `Tribe` contract](https://github.com/fei-protocol/fei-protocol-core/blob/29aeefddd97f31c7f2a598fb3dca3ef24dc0beb4/contracts/dao/Tribe.sol#L247)
* [`permit` in the `Tribe` contract](https://github.com/fei-protocol/fei-protocol-core/blob/29aeefddd97f31c7f2a598fb3dca3ef24dc0beb4/contracts/dao/Tribe.sol#L172)
* [`permit` in the `Fei` contract](https://github.com/fei-protocol/fei-protocol-core/blob/29aeefddd97f31c7f2a598fb3dca3ef24dc0beb4/contracts/token/Fei.sol#L101)


This function is already part of the OpenZeppelin Contracts, which has been audited and is constantly reviewed by the community. Consider importing and using the recover function from [OpenZeppelin’s `ECDSA` library](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/release-v3.1.0/contracts/cryptography/ECDSA.sol) not only to benefit from bug fixes to be applied in future releases, but also to reduce the code’s attack surface.


**Update:** *Not fixed. In the words of the Fei Team: “We want to minimize changes to forked DAO contracts”.*
